We were unfamiliar with the streets in the area and Gustavo found us a map and explained about the freeway access that we needed. Gustavo took very good care of us and made sure all our needs were met.

Reviews.Title: “We hold our meetings here...”
Reviews.Author: Lmiller31310
Reviews.Content: .....about every 3 months and my company continues to go back. The staff is extremely courteous and helpful. I 'd like to send a shout out to Roberto Hdez in Banquet who graciously helped me get organized and clean up after my meeting Day 1. Then he came back to help me at the end of day 2 when I was trying to rush out and catch a flight. He made my clean up easier and was a huge help with making sure my boxes got out to the Fedex pickup. Thank you Sheraton, see you again soon!

Reviews.Title: “Excellent service during busy times”
Reviews.Author: Stefan095
Reviews.Content: Just wanted to say "hats off" to the staff at Sheraton Downtown. I've stayed here a few times the last 10 years and this time during the busy E3 show and I was very impressed with their high service level. I've travel a lot all over the world and this was probably one of my best stays so far 2011. Everything I asked for was arranged with a smile. Taxi's, luggage, breakfast, laundry and extended check-out (spg gold) I can highly recommend the Sheraton downtown, thank you Victor, Lyndia H, Edgar M and the rest of the team. Stefan ( from London)

Reviews.Title: “Parking is expansive and you need to park on the fourth floor which is macy's parking place!!”
Reviews.Author: Jshen
Reviews.Content: I was there for two nights and it was not great!! As I said, parking is way to expensive and if you choose self-park you need to park on the fourth floor. It is $ 28 per night, and valet parking is $32 or $34 per nigh. If you use self-parking you need to walk through macy's to the hotel. The lobby is clean,nice, and beautiful. They provide free internet and computers in the lobby. The bar is pretty nice. The staff was nice, but when I was there the room key didn't work. So, I had to come down and tell her "it's not working". She was nice and changed another room for us. She was saying it is because the new system or something that make the room key doesn't work; she hope this time "will" work. We got in to the "NEW" room which is on 10th floor, and the view is not beautiful. The building next door block the view. It's a king size room, and it's nice and quiet. The bed was comfit, but the bathroom was not clean. There were some plastic bag stock into the bathtub, and it's just not clean. The remote was not working well. We had to click twice or more to switch the channel. Overall: I don't think it was worthy. I paid that much and the service was okay. Maybe you think it's a bad luck, but I think a 4th ranking hotel shouldn't like this. I have stayed in many high ranking hotel, and this is the worst experience ever!! If you need to stay in LA for a business trip, this place will be a good place to stay because of the great location, free internet, and the valet parking. BUT, the service and hotel computer system need some improvements.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful views, but not perfect service”
Reviews.Author: Trankkis
Reviews.Content: We stayed here one night with an upgrade to a corner room like on the tripadvisor room pics. In the evening, the views were fantastic but the windows very dirty. It's a plus that you can open them, but the building is a bit old - very loud noise from the street despite being on one of the highest floors. Also, a doorman lost our bag from the way to the room from our car using valet parking.

Reviews.Title: “Great location if you like Macy's”
Reviews.Author: mary92651
Reviews.Content: The Sheraton is within the Macy's Center which was a surprise to find a hotel in a shopping mall. I was told there is a fitness center, but in fact rather than a hotel facility it is a Bally's fitness within the mall. The hotel charges for internet, but there are free computers and printer in the lobby which was helpful in printing out theatre tickets etc. Great location for walking to the music center, MOCA, central libray and many restaurantes nearby. The room was upgraded to a suite, nice view out to the L.A. Live area of town. Basically a very good hotel for a reasonable price found on their website. Less than other travel sites. AAA discount took significant amount off price.

Reviews.Title: “Perfectly adequate with great staff”
Reviews.Author: superstardj
Reviews.Content: I stayed here as part of a week long stay in LA where I also spent nights in the W Hollywood and the SLS Beverly hills. The SLS is a beautiful hotel, but for my final 2 nights I was mainly going to be working, and I didn't see the point of spending $600 a night on a suite when all was going to be doing was sitting behind the desk. So I decamped to the much cheaper Sheraton Downtown. And what can I say? I really was very happy there. It's a mid tier Sheraton, not the newest but not the oldest either, and the area of downtown is actually pretty OK with Macys, Starbucks, Walgreens all very close. Everything you need. I also really liked Octopus (sushi restaurant opposite) which served pretty decent sushi that was also, like the hotel, great value. Top marks go the staff who were superbly friendly both on the front desk and around the hotel, exceptionally so in fact - it was them that made me decide to write this review. One negative is that the hotel does not have it's own gym - instead you sign into the Bally gym in the shopping arcade. The distance is not a problem but the gym is fairly horrible, a fairly old 1980s style place. So if you do like a nice private hotel gym, you'll miss that here. So in summary, it's not somewhere I'd bring a date to impress and won't be on my top 10 list of hotels, but for a solid Sheraton to kill a few days working in LA in, it did a great job.

Reviews.Title: “Sheraton Should Debrand This Location”
Reviews.Author: fishervan123
Reviews.Content: I wish I had read these BAD reviews before I booked as they all came true. They made a mistake with my parking bill, there is nothing in the area except for a lot of harassing homeless people, the hotel does look run down, the heating/cooling system was so extreme even when I change it but a few degrees and mildew in the washroom... I guess I should be happy that I didn't have anything stolen like another guest! Tip: book elsewhere.

Reviews.Title: “Horrible location, horrible parking”
Reviews.Author: perryinvancouver
Reviews.Content: The hotel definitely deserves all the bad reviews it receives. Before booking I saw the many, many bad reviews but I also saw a really great deal - well, you get what you pay for. Firstly, the location is not for tourists as it's in a business area and all there is on the weekends is the tiny mall it's attached to and a lot of homeless people all over the area. Parking was my biggest beef, firstly I self-parked and they charged me the extra $4 for Valet even though I was clearly asked and given directions for Self-Parking at check in. I've left 2 messages to the hotel since my stay 1.5 weeks ago and they have failed to rectify the $4. The self parking is located 5 floors up then you have to take the mall elevator back to the ground floor and walk from one end of the mall to the other where the hotel is then go back up the hotel elevator. The hotel is old and tired. I wanted directions to the Staples Center and it was like pulling teeth from the bellboys who were too busy chatting with each other. The Staples Center is about the only place you can walk to as there is nothing else in the area. The location is definitely not for families as you get a homeless person asking you for changing every block and you're lucky if they leave you alone or follow you for a block or two trying hard for change. We went to inside Subway to get a sandwich and the homeless guy waited for us and followed us back to the hotel. Overall, the hotel deserves all the bad ratings it is receiving.

Reviews.Title: “Run-down and Tired ... especially for $250/night.”
Reviews.Author: FeltonS
Reviews.Content: I stayed here for six nights during a recent convention, and I found myself asking the same question every night: how on earth does Sheraton get off charging $250/night for a room with worn out brown carpet and run-down furniture that looks like it was installed in the 1970s? It's not that the hotel is terrible - it's just that it's not very good. All of the things that you expect from a Sheraton - like across-the-board good service - just don't happen here. For example, the in-house internet. It is spotty, with frequent outages. But my call to guest services to resolve the problem merely resulted in the operator transfering the caller to an AT&T operators and a ten minute wait to talk to someone who couldn't resolve the problem. So, instead, I found myself waiting an additional twenty minutes for the network to come back on. And that's what happens, and how you resolve a problem, when a hotel decides to outsource a basic service. I must say, some of the employees are very good. And some are very bad and in need of training. For example, one night my key card was demagnetized and I asked the front desk to reprogram it. The fellow put it in the machine, claimed to re-program it, and then I returned to my room ... where it didn't open the door. I returned to the front desk, asked him to do it again, he did ... and it still didn't open the door. This happened twice more before he figured out how to do it. Not good. It's no accident that this hotel is rated a 3.5 stars on tripadvisor: the management and staff have earned it This is not up to Sheraton standards AT ALL. Take my word: there are better hotels with cheaper rates within walking distance. I suggest trying one of them.

Reviews.Title: “Great service - Libby treated me like a rock star”
Reviews.Author: AdamS256
Reviews.Content: So I flew into LA on Sunday night for a conference at the convention center starting on Monday. I'm an SPG member and I wanted to stay at an SPG property. The Westin towers were too far outside my company's policy, so I stayed at the Sheraton Downtown LA and I am glad I did! Libby at the front desk welcomed me on check in and treated me like royalty. I've never had such a nice room in any Sheraton, EVER. She worked hard to make my stay truly enjoyable. I would highly recommend staying at the Downtown LA Sheraton.

Reviews.AuthorLocation: Washington DC, District of Columbia, USA
Reviews.Title: “How Can You NOT Have AC in 2011?!”
Reviews.Author: JLJ20507
Reviews.Content: The hotel was fine. The staff was fine. The parking was fine. What was not fine was the fact that guests cannot control the temperature in their guest rooms. My room was sweltering as there was nothing to be done about it... the best they can offer is "cool air." And it wasn't cool.... Don't stay here if you care at all about the temp of your room.

Reviews.Title: “Bad customer service... And that was before my iPad was stolen!”
Reviews.Author: CallMeKylar
Reviews.Content: So let me tell you a horror story that was my one night stay at this hellish Sheraton Hotel. My girlfriend and I stayed here when we were in town to watch a Clippers/Celtics game. We check in and find that her dad and her sister have a room with one bed in it. Not going to work and not what was purchased. They call the front desk to switch rooms and 15 minutes later they are in a double-bed room and all is peachy right? Wrong. We get back to the hotel after the game to find that we can't get into our room. The keys don't work. We go downstairs to see what the problem is. Looks like they canceled our room instead of the room that they were supposed to cancel (the one with the single bed). Great Big FAIL. We get new room keys and return to the hotel room and TRY to sleep. Jesus it was hot in there and made for a difficult and sweaty night. We wake up the next morning and find that my iPad, which was sitting on the table charging, is gone. In shock and distraught I go down to report the theft to the front desk. Apparently this was a nuisance to the front desk employee as he seemed put off that I would even ask for any help regarding my situation. It took half an hour for their "Head of Security" to come out and "help." He then proceeds to get my name wrong twice while attempting to write his information on a small notepad paper resting on his knee. Awesome. So glad we chose to stay here. By the way that was sarcastic. Be forewarned. Do NOT stay at this hotel. You more than likely will not get your money's worth or leave without one of your most prized possessions.

Reviews.Title: “Outstanding”
Reviews.Author: SoCal_Worldtraveller
Reviews.Content: This hotel is outstanding. From the moment I arrived and was met by the valet parking attendant, I knew this was going to be good. Check in staff was pleasant and helpful. I think because of my status, which I think is only preferred and not even to the silver level, I got a free breakfast buffet coupon. It was a full American breakfast buffet. Great surprise! The hotel room was clean, updated and you have to love the bedding. Only two comments and they are both nits: 1) during the check in process, the check in staff person stated, “the valet parking costs are included in your bill”, which I thought meant “included in the price”, but what he really meant was the cost ($32) for the valet service will be “added” to the bill. 2) It seemed like the hot water was running low (I was on the 20th floor), as I had to keep increasing the hot water amount during my shower. Kind of an odd experience at a hotel, almost like being at your house after several people have taken a shower. Overall though, a great hotel. Highly recommend this place

Reviews.Title: “Quite Possibly the worst Hotel in LA”
Reviews.Author: duckfisney
Reviews.Content: I arrived 2/12/11 at the Sheraton downtown not expecting much as my starwood experiences have been less than stellar for the past several years. My concern was not unfounded! first room had a toilet constantly dripping, mildew in the grout of the bathroom and basically no A/C . Second room toilet was fine, mildew was way way worse (smelly too) and still no A/C also was an adjoining room (always potential for annoying noise!). third room they were "nice" enough to me give me a corner room on a "preferred floor" the nice room was at least 90 degrees because apparently the A/C in the entire hotel doesn't work (admitted by two front desk clerks!) and this is february, hate to see this place in August! the room is still dark, dingy and dirty like most starwood properties and yes had an adjoining door even after my request to avoid that. when I told the desk staff before leaving for dinner that there was still no A/C and the room largely sucked but I had given up on trying to get something decent I was told that the front desk manager, who swore she would call me after 10 minutes to make sure the room was OK (30 minutes ago) was on a conference call and couldn't talk to me! Anyway, come back from dinner to find a box fan sitting outside my door. Seriously a box fan! how exactly will blowing hot air around help? the windows that were designed to open are all screwed shut, no shot at getting fresh air! Insult to injury it takes 4 calls to the desk to get the message light on my phone turned off, please! I am stuck here for another 9 nights on a client provided hotel business trip, if I were paying the tab you can bet I would have been out of here like a shot! I can't even drink heavily 'cause its six bucks a draft at the rotten hotel bar! This trip has reminded me why I tore up my starwood card and threw it at a westin manager years ago!

Reviews.Title: “Unacceptable”
Reviews.Author: BobRockies
Reviews.Content: They overbooked. I made a reservation 2 months ahead. They had no room for me and sent me to another low end hotel. Imagine if I had my kids with me. I am not booking again in a Sheraton

Reviews.Title: “Great night's sleep here”
Reviews.Author: untired26
Reviews.Content: We enjoyed our stay at this hotel in December and over into the New Year. The bedding and pillows were some of the best I've ever slept on and under. The refurbished room was comfortable, but I do miss having two easy chairs. Many hotels now seem to opt for that swivel, rolling desk chair. The bathroom was spacious and comfortable and I always appreciate having easy access in and out of tubs and showers. I am not disabled, but tend to slip in tubs. The Sheraton made access very safe. The downside was an eternal wait for elevators. There were only four in the hallway and everytime it arrived on the seventh floor from floors above, it was full. After waiting nearly thirty minutes one evening, we walked the stairs down to the ground floor exit. But I don't recommend doing that either. The staff was efficient and pleasant. The bar/lounge was pricey and limited to it's selection but served our purpose. We enjoyed a nice breakfast at the restaurant but did not take the buffet as was strongly suggested. We are not fans of buffets. The food was fine. The location was excellent with so many things within walking distance. Two nice big pharmacies were right across the street and fast food and sit down restaurants were also plentiful and walkable.

Reviews.Title: “A fantastic stay with Sheraton downtown LA”
Reviews.Author: jonathanvigil89
Reviews.Content: I was impressed with this stay the staff was all helpful and the rooms were expectational. The comfort of the beds really let you rest. the hotel is in a great location and the cafe and restaurant is also great. In whole this place is awesome and I know i will be stay their again, and I recommend it to any one that like the best! Thanks Sheraton for the great hospitality. I also want to thank Maricor Lopez for making our stay the best service Ive ever experienced she gave us the best service and helped us with everything we need and I appreciate all of that help. Thank You Maricor Lopez.

Reviews.Title: “Me like!”
Reviews.Author: CalJP
Reviews.Content: My first stay at this property dates back to the times when it was know as the Hyatt downtown LA. The hotel went through a renovation some years ago which regretfully did not encompass the bathrooms and there is a contract in the quality of the finishes between the bedroom and bathroom (I do not sleep in the bathroom so that's not the end of the world). The only downside was the "high speed internet" which is officially provided through AT&T (with remnants of a previous provider) which was neither high speed nor reliable (kept on dropping my wireless connection to our corporate server) I ultimately gave up and used my mifi 2200 which was more reliable and faster. Now for the really good stuff: What I noticed this visit which really struck me was the level of service which we experienced throughout the hotel during our two night stay...the staff was really "polished" and seemed genuinely interest in making your stay pleasant. I was very very impressed.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent”
Reviews.Author: Italtom77
Reviews.Content: Very nice hotel, good breakfast and very comfortable bed.

Reviews.Title: “Nice location, poor rooms”
Reviews.Author: pedroschmidt
Reviews.Content: I arrived at the hotel on August 10th, for a 4 day stay with some friends. From the beggining we were mistreated by the hotel staff, who at the check-in made poor jokes about our intention to all stay in the same floor. The rooms were terrible, old and poorly cared for, this hotel definetely needs a restoration. I wouldn't recommend it to anyone, though it is very well located, close to the Staples Center and all the downtown L.A. nightlife.

Reviews.Title: “the only place to stay in downtown L.A.”
Reviews.Author: spaceis411
Reviews.Content: the ONLY reason to stay anywhere is the service. and the front desk staff was superb. Gustavo Gomez not only had the right restaurant recommendations, but performed his job with joy. really, joy. as a former property manager, i tend to have high expectations anywhere i go - not often am i as delighted as i was upon arrival here in the downtown L.A.

Reviews.Title: “maricor lopez at the front desk is awesome”
Reviews.Author: mommydearist
Reviews.Content: my business partner & i (along with my 20 month old daughter) traveled to LA for the "kids on 6" trade show, checked into the hotel & was lucky enough to have maricor help us! we had reserved a standard room & i asked her if there was one room configuration over another that would be better for us since we needed a crib. she checked her computer & said she could upgrade us to a jr. suite but we would have to share a bed. we said that would be ok if there was more room for olive to run around...she then clicked around on her computer a bit more & said if we'd like she could upgrade us to a full sized suite (WOW, yes) bedroom, two bathrooms & a living room/dining room...needless to say having that much room made our stay absolutely wonderful! thank you marisol for helping us so greatly, you were fantastic!

Reviews.Title: “Gustave Gomez Saves the Day!”
Reviews.Author: TheLiterati
Reviews.Content: My friend and I were staying at the Downtown LA Sheraton as part of a large group (marathon team) participating in the Inaugural LA Rock 'N' Roll Half Marathon. We arrived at the hotel at about 1:30 pm, hoping for an early check-in, but more importantly hoping to arrange a late check-out the next day, as we were among the last corral of race participants and likely would not make it back before the 12 noon check-out. The first person we encountered at the front desk was quite nice, very professional and tried to help get us a 1pm checkout; however because our room was not ready yet, she could not make the change on the computer and suggested we come back at 3 and try again. The next person we encountered was, in a word, horrid. She explained, rather rudely, that "all hotels have a standard 3pm check in and 12 pm check out." Um, really? In addition to being patronizing and condescending, she had the nerve to tell us "Well, your room isn't ready anyway, so you'll have to come back in about a half-hour." So it's OK for us to have our check-in delayed, but we couldn't check out an hour late? Go figure. Furious but determined to make the best of our weekend, my friend and I headed out to find a late lunch. Upon returning to the desk, we encountered yet another staff member - Gustave - and explained our situation yet again. At first he was concerned that there were no double rooms available - a pity because our accommodation arrangements had been made months in advance. At that point we were about to completely loose it, but Gustave saved the day. He made sure that we had the best accommodations available and granted our late checkout request, allowing us to completely enjoy our race day getaway. Our room was comfortable and clean, the beds slept well, and though our visit was relatively short, we had a good overnight stay. I'd honestly have to say that while the hotel website boasts of a recent remodel, the room wasn't as nice as other hotels I've visited. However, because of the exemplary service we received from Gustave Gomez, I had to give another star. His attitude and exemplary service really made all the difference. Thank you Gustave for making our stay memorable.

Reviews.Title: “Very low graded Quality Bed”
Reviews.Author: pkong13141
Reviews.Content: I barely could sleep there. First, the bed was full size and was too uncomfortable,may be it is too soft. Secondly, I requested for the quiet room, the gentleman assigned us RM 601 where is located right above the traffic light. I was woken up by couple times of "siren" from ambulance and times of buses came by in the middle of the night. Valet Parking is $32/day. Self Parking is $28/day. There are limited amenities in the hotel, don't expect there is fitness center, pool, sauna or steam room. No daily newspaper. There are about 4-5 pc in a circle as a Business Center in the middle of the lobby. However, there was still one thing impressed us was the front desk staffs, they are friendly to customers.

Reviews.Title: “Service was exceptional!”
Reviews.Author: Nicole091
Reviews.Content: The staff were polite and friendly. They went out of their way to ensure we were comfortable. They gave great advice about things to do and see and how to get around the city. The room was modern with a very large, flat screen tv and great desk space. I would definitely recommend this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “An excellent choice when visiting USC”
Reviews.Author: AmyL55
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed here for 2 nights for USC parents weekend. We arrived very late the first night (11pm) and they said they had overbooked (never heard of that before in a hotel!) Nevertheless, the very nice guy at the desk (Gustavo Gomez) said he could upgrade us to a room that normally costs $500 if we joined the "Starwood Club" (for free), which we did. So we got a room on the 23rd floor. We expected it to be spectacular with that build up, but it was just a normal room, nothing special, as expected for $169/night. They also threw in complimentary continental breakfasts too, which was very nice. The rest of our stay was really nice too. The cocktails and appetizers at the bar downstairs are excellent. Be forewarned that a continental breakfast does not include the hot items at the buffet -- we made that mistake the first day and had to pay extra. Another feature of this hotel is that it's pretty easy to get to USC. We decided not to rent a car for this trip and it paid off. There is easy bus transportation to USC from about 2 blocks away on bus 81. And a cab between USC and the hotel is only about $15, including tip. So it's much cheaper than renting a car. All in all, a nice trip and we would stay at this hotel again. Next time, though, we will check in earlier!! They said if you can't be there in person to check in, you can simply call in.

Reviews.Title: “Sheraton Downtown -- my favorite place to stay in downtown LA!”
Reviews.Author: RockyNRoll
Reviews.Content: The staff at Sheraton Downtown is so professional, responsive, and friendly. They're the reason I stay at Sheraton now for all of my visits to LA (that is, unless they're booked and I'm forced to stay another place). The hotel is really nice and is conveniently located in the downtown financial district, within walking distance to all kinds of great shops, including Macy's and several vendors that are located right in the same building complex (not to mention the Walgreens and Rite Aid right across the street -- can't get more convenient). I've stayed at other downtown hotels (Bonaventure, Wilshire Grand, etc.) but Sheraton Downtown is the best, hands down. It's now the only place for me when I come to LA for business or pleasure.

Reviews.Title: “Top notch, friendly and accomodating”
Reviews.Author: pkdactive
Reviews.Content: Only stayed two nights and wished we could extend as we were given a complimentary upgrade to an amazing duplex penthouse suite! All staff we came in contact with were friendly and helpful. The lobby is spacious and welcoming, with free computer access and wifi connection. The bar and breakfast buffet were fine. Our room was clean, the bed was luxurious and the furnishings modern and comfortable. I highly recommend this hotel and would stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, not pleasant first impression”
Reviews.Author: bunny_on_journey
Reviews.Content: Arrival was very stressful and it was all thanks to Valet Parking Man Screaming his head of on everybody who was pulling in front entrance and not requesting valet parking, telling us we have to drive to car parking, even thought we haven’t checked in ye and don’t have parking ticket. He was expecting from us, to get to hotel parking unpack all suitcases and drag them all the way thru elevators and shopping centre, so we could check in. Well all this time when he was screaming he could help us out take the suitcases and there will be no issue. At first I thought that maybe he simply didn’t liked us, but the same happened to other couple. They came back as they have left phone in the lobby on the sofas. I was standing behind closed glass door, with the traffic outside and I have heard every word what this guy was saying to the poor girl behind a wheel. Anyway maybe it was just his bad day or so. We have stayed in Sheraton for a first time for two nights 18th -20th September. Overall we have wonderful time, check in went smoothly, staff was very helpful and kind. Room we got was really big, modern design, very clean and well appointed. Bathroom was great too. Beds were very comfortable. We have enjoyed ourselves in bar downstairs and there was nice souvenir shop too. Location was perfect for us, we wanted to see a bit of downtown, so we took a nice walk to Walt Disney Concert Hall. Hotel is adjacent to Macys and there are few other shops like Victoria Secrets too.

Reviews.Title: “Seemed to be hidden expenses everywhere but nice hotel”
Reviews.Author: Mark87008
Reviews.Content: The hotel itself was excellent but hidden expenses seemed to be everywher. $30 per day car parking, Wi-Fi in room not free but available at a price i cant remember - however there is free Wi-Fi / computers in reception, not handy when you're on the 15th floor. Bottled water in room at $6 a bottle. The one thing that did really annoy me is the fact there was no safety deposit box in the room- which seems standard in US these days, the're available behind reception but too be honest are so dated and small its easier to carry your stuff round. Nice hotel which i would probably stop in again knowing the hidden charges but wouldnt recommend to a first time visitor.

Reviews.Title: “Great service.”
Reviews.Author: intlV
Reviews.Content: The standout amenities of the Sheraton LA Downtown are the customer service, and the location. From the moment you pull up in your car you're bombarded with helpful staff. It's definitely 5 star service. The Staples Center is a brisk walk away (you can walk to it in sneakers, not heels), and taxis are always nearby so you never have to wait for one to be called (although I'm sure the staff wouldn't mind doing that for you). There are two drugstores right across the street, a mini-Starbucks in the gift shop, and a small mall inside with the hotel. A vegan restaurant is a couple of blocks north, and there's an IHOP on the very next block west. I think there's a church downstairs too. Anything you could possibly need is literally right near your fingertips. If you must something to complain about, it'd probably be the TVs and the elevators. The TVs are a little weird - they're perfectly fine plasmas, but the OS to channel surf is extremely slow. I never even found a way to channel surf; you have to go through the menu to the local channels, then scroll through all the options. It takes 1-2 minutes just to change the channel. Maybe the settings were messed up on my set; either way I just gave up on watching TV altogether. The elevators are usually fast, but not when there are a ton of people using them; you can literally be standing there for 3 minutes. If you're someone who runs late all the time, you might find it annoying to stay here during a large event. The rooms are clean, with huge windows and white comforters. There is no free WiFi, but there is free internet at the link center, with a charging center/laptop workstation right next to it. They even have board games to kill time. I'll definitely stay here again whenever I'm in the downtown area.

Reviews.Title: “Good hotel for the rate we paid”
Reviews.Author: Perlee
Reviews.Content: We stayed here during labor day weekend. Got a corner room with 2 double beds on the 8th floor. Room was spacious. Still looked a bit old even though they said it was renovated. Overall was very decent for the price that we paid ($125 a night with tax and internet). Valet parking was expensive ($32 per night). I would not say this is a 4 star hotel- more likely 3.5 star.

Reviews.Title: “Hotel looks nice from outside only. Room was DISGUSTING. See pics”
Reviews.Author: steven231
Reviews.Content: Arrival at this hotel makes you think you are staying somewhere nice. The staff is helpful and friendly and lobby is nicely appointed. The room....was the most disgusting I have ever stayed in! My first room was hot, had dirty walls, dirty everything, nasty. I thought it was a fluke so I traded to another room. EXACT same thing. I called the desk and asked how to turn on the a/c. They sent an engineer to the room who took a measurement of the temp and said it was 76 degrees in the room and the a/c was on full blast. Then he explained how there is one a/c unit and blower for the entire building and the way it works it, you slide the lever for temp control (see pic), and as you slide it, a mechanism in the ceiling opens and closes a flap to let in more air or less. My flap was open all the way and their air was barely trickling in....he told me that's full force, and it takes a few hours for the rooms to cool off in the afternoon, because the sun hits the windows and the blower isn't strong enough! What kind of outdated system is that? The walls were dirty, as if not painted in years. There was water damaged, peeling wall paper in the bath room. The bathroom ceiling had moldy spots. The bath room was old and outdated. Actually, the entire room was outdated except for the TV, which is new, flat screen. Sounded like a bowling alley in the ceiling....check for yourself...room 709....there are mechanisms in the ceiling that make noise all day...all night. Terrible stay. See some pics below. Dump hotel. Worst stay I ever remember from a Sheraton.

Reviews.Title: “Good stay...disappointed in air controls”
Reviews.Author: JoonB
Reviews.Content: Good location, reasonable group rates. Complained about 78 degree room temp on day one. Maintenance solution was to unscrew the window and let in the warm LA summer. At night cooled to around 70.

Reviews.Title: “Lousy service”
Reviews.Author: Elle_01234
Reviews.Content: My friends and I arrived at the hotel around 1pm and were informed that our rooms were not ready yet (hotel policy: check in at 3pm) which was understandable. We were told to arrive at 3pm to get our rooms, which we did. As it turned out only one out of the four rooms was in fact ready. For the rest we were told to wait another 1h30min. I went up to my room (the only one that was ready at 3pm) and 5-10 min later someone tried to get inside my room with their key. The door actually opened but I had the additional lock on (plus I shouted), so whoever it was couldn't get in. They immediately closed the door and knocked on the door, as if they hadn't just barged in, and then left! I can only assume it was the cleaning staff who hadn't been informed that the room had been given to a customer. 10 min later I had a call from the reception that I had to vacate the room because they couldn't find rooms for my friends on the same floor...So I packed up again and changed rooms. All of the inconvenience to me and my friends was met with indeference and, on occasion, roodness by the reception staff. Add to that that the reception staff, apparently, weren't native Americans and had difficulty communicating in English. All in all a very bad experience. I would not recommend it to anyone.

Reviews.Title: “Unclean room”
Reviews.Author: JAH6
Reviews.Content: We visited the Sheraton for one night. We arrived very late after going to a baseball game. Although check-in was prompt, when we arrived at our room we discovered both beds piled with dirty linens, towels all over the bathroom floors, two full glasses of wine, and six more glasses containing what looked like the melted remnants of some kind of liquor on ice. There were boxes on the chairs, and we actually had to check the closets to make sure we hadn't walked into an occupied room. We were with two of our kids, both very tired at this point, so my husband called the front desk. He was told that we would be called back as soon as an alternative room was found and were assured it wouldn't be more than 5 minutes. We never recieved a call and were beginning to get impatient when about 8 minutes later, someone knocked on the door with keys to a new room. While the situation was resolved (albeit not within the stated timeframe), I am still disappointed in the Sheraton's service. I cannot understand why any room would be assigned to a guest without the assurance that it was cleaned. I have traveled a fair amount and never have I had anywhere near this kind of experience before.

Reviews.Title: “Thank you Mr.Roy”
Reviews.Author: shaunakd
Reviews.Content: Mr. Roy helped me a lot at making the super shuttle resevervation from the hotel to LAX. He was kind enough to spend his time on this even though he was busy. If he would not have helped me, I would have faced lot of trouble in reaching the LAX. Thank you very much Mr.Roy.

Reviews.Title: “Just OK...better for business or if you never leave your hotel room”
Reviews.Author: mrskk07
Reviews.Content: Pros: Great staff- very friendly and helpful Comfortable Beds Large room Right in downtown LA Decent hotel food Cons: Walls are paper thin Some of the furniture in the room SMELLED! Numerous problems with the WiFi No Pool Right in downtown LA Let me start by stating that my husband had to stay here on business and I came along. We didn't choose to stay here and if it were up to me I probably wouldn't choose to stay here. It definitely caters to the businessperson and I wouldn't recommend it for a family. The location is ok- Near a number of good restaurants and close to the LA convention center, LA Live, etc. Any touristy type activities required a car or a taxi. There is a Metro stop across the street, but I wasn't comfortable using it. I regularly use the subways in NYC without reservation, but for some reason the Metro here made me unsettled. So unless you have access to a car or feel like trying the Metro, plan on spending at least $20 each way to get to any tourist attractions. The "mall" that is connected to the hotel consists of a few stores such as Bath & Body Works, Victoria's Secret and Macy's-pretty slim pickings if you want to do some shopping. The closest shopping center is The Grove which is a $30 cab ride away. There isn't even a bookstore near by. Our first night here we had to call the front desk because of our neighbors. The wall are paper thin! There was a family staying next door and while I sympathize with having to deal with cranky and rambunctious children I don't want to spend the night listening to them. The front desk offered to move us. Staff was very friendly and even sympathetic when I looked myself out of our room. Although pricey, the food was pretty good for a hotel. I did have to call three times for WiFi connectivity issues. The provider stated that they were having some issues and I could go downstairs and use the computers in the lobby. Kind of annoying that in order to get online I had to go downstairs. Overall an ok hotel for business, but I wouldn't recommend for the casual traveler or for someone who wants to enjoy all that LA has to offer. There has to be better out there.

Reviews.Title: “comfortable and accomodating”
Reviews.Author: ROC-SD
Reviews.Content: This would be the 4th year staying at this hotel. This year I had originally booked through a convention registration and they mucked it all up. Thankfully the front desk was VERYYY helpful and accomodating. I brought my two teenage girls and three of their friends. They were comfortable and never did they look unsecure. This year we stayed in a 2 bedroom suite. It was clean and comfy. The bathroom was smaller than remember but it worked. We usually stay here because of the food court at the mall. It's had better years but the convenience of having a quick/inexpensive meal is nice (since i have teens, it can get rather expensive during these conventions.) The parking is pricey but I'll pay for pricey in exchange for our safety. The only problem I had with this hotel was easily dealt with, with a phone call. For some odd reason it showed/charged me as a no show for two rooms. Now mind you, the original people that booked our room mucked it up so it could of been their fault. Overall the stay was great. Just wished they had a pool!!!

Reviews.Title: “Good Downtown LA Location”
Reviews.Author: peter_vpnet
Reviews.Content: Nice convenient location downtown. There are drug stores located across the street and a shopping mall on premise. Club level not open on the weekend. The staff was friendly and enjoyed my stay overall. Perhaps not the best area to be in after-hours. Nothing very fancy but comfortable.

Reviews.Title: “Train Wreck”
Reviews.Author: Patoriisu
Reviews.Content: When we made our original reservations they took out the money in advance, which is fine, but then when we got there they couldn't find our reservation. The gentleman at the desk was nice enough but when we had to go through all the hassle of figuring out where our room was. They admitted that it was their mistake when we found out that the reservation was for the wrong hotel. They refunded my money and then said they were going to set me up with a new room at the correct hotel. I went to the desk at the new room was twice what I was paying and for the wrong dates. I again had to call and set up a new reservation and inform them of their mistake again. They set me up with a third room and didn't charge me for the second room. After my trip I check my bank account and they took out the money AGAIN.

Reviews.Title: “Nothing special, except...”
Reviews.Author: bruisedlee
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for the Korean Music Festival at a rate of $149/nt. With taxes and the parking fee, my bill came down to $197. The primary reason why I chose this place was because they were the sponsor hotel for the concert, and most of - if not all - the Korean artists were staying there. Looks like that was the only perk of our stay. The room was surprisingly much smaller than I expected. Nothing really special, except maybe the Sweet Sleeper beds. Frankly, I've had better accommodations at the Holiday Inn Express. The elevators were jerky, too. It always gave us a laugh whenever we go for a ride in them. However front desk was always courteous and helpful.

Reviews.Title: “A great place to stay near LAX”
Reviews.Author: StevenAEpstein
Reviews.Content: Very good facility. Clean. Subway with walking distance if not on expense account. Good bar, food. Club Lounge is very good. Staff is great. It's fun to watch the planes take off. Self parking is a short but annoying hike behind facility.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic Club Lounge Concierge!”
Reviews.Author: Businesstraveler39
Reviews.Content: The concierge in the Club Lounge on the 23rd floor, Ms. Minnie Sanders, was fantastic. Her pleasant demeanor, attention to detail and accomodating nature made visiting the Club Lounge on the 23rd floor an energizing and refreshing experience. I visited the lounge everyday during my stay especially because Ms. Sanders was such a gracious host and a stellar representation of the quality brand the Sheraton is known to be worldwide. She made my stay here at the Sheraton during a hectic and stressful E3 Expo convention a relaxing and refreshing one, her hospitality was appreciated and I highly recommend the Sheraton Los Angeles Downtown Hotel if you are staying in the Los Angeles area.

Reviews.Title: “Are you kidding?!”
Reviews.Author: swede1970
Reviews.Content: I was to appear on a TV show, so they paid for it. I am from Kansas and brought my boyfriend and 18 yr. old son. At $249/night, this was nothing special at all. The room was very warm. The air conditioning was like a light switch, on and off. The controls to heat and cool was a slider switch - warm to cool. And the cool was about 75 degrees of dead air. No flow of fresh air whatsoever. Horrible, just would not get any cooler. No exhaust fan in the bathroom, so that made it worse on trying to cool off after warm shower. Free wifi but still had to pay for the connection, which i did not do. There was a $6 bottle of Figi water which i could get for under $2 elsewhere. There were patched up holes in the walls, very basic cable with nothing on, had to pay for movies, which i didn't even want to know the price of that. No pool. And breakfast, WOW! $13 for a two egg omelete. Be real people. We walked to Subway for supper ($5 footlongs) and the $2.50 breakfast. So, considering someone else paid for it, I will never go back. In my city i have paid for a suite with a small kitchen unit, very nicely decorated, exhaust fan, air conditioning i can control to get colder and complimentary breakfast for $79 a night.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel in perfect location”
Reviews.Author: SuzanneV
Reviews.Content: I was a little wary about this hotel after reading the review on here, but my experience couldn't have been better. I got a pretty good deal on a package through Expedia, so it was a good value for what I paid. The room was standard for a 3.5 star, business-friendly hotel, and certainly not less quiet that any other urban hotel I've visited. I used public transit to get around LA, so the location was absolutely perfect (centrally located in a pretty upscale part of downtown with bars and restaurants within a few blocks, across the street from the Metro station, and a few blocks from all the major bus lines). The staff was very friendly (though I only encountered them at check-in/out and in passing) and the computers in the lobby with free internet and a drugstore across the street were convenient. It was a great experience and I would stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Bed Bug Infestation”
Reviews.Author: quietstorm_co
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the Los Angeles Downtown Sheraton in early May. Most staff were nice. You can tell the hotel was very nice at one time. However, it is run down. The sink top was dirty when I arrived and the room carpet was dirty (old and stained). Wireless in the room and wired connections are managed through Wayport (now AT&T wireless) and absolutely sucks! The front desk admitted that they only have one T1 to support all connections for the hotel (back office and guest rooms). An absolute joke. Worst of all - my room was infested with bedbugs. I didn't discover this until the 4th day of my stay. Now, I am facing a huge dry cleaning bill and have to purchase a new suitcase - I don't want to take any chances with a "cleaned" bag. The staff was unhelpful and offered me a new room only after I showed them one of the bugs I killed. The room they put me in was off of the lease floor, was older than the rest of the hotel, and just as dirty as the first room. Thankfully, I only had to stay one night in that room.

Reviews.Title: “Good location ... convenience ... and value”
Reviews.Author: TravelerPromise
Reviews.Content: The Good .. Location in the downtown area (easy walking to center city locations) Parking is easy and convenient (self-parking or valet with in-out at a reasonable price) in shared parking arrangement with the Macy's shopping center ... allows for early morning parking before check-in, so check-in later easy and convenient to car. Room was very nice with king size bed, bathroom, sitting chair and table, flat screen, working desk and chair, internet available (wired or wireless) Lobby area nice with internet kiosk (free wired and wireless), lounge area, bar and restaurant (restaurant really important since downtown Los Angeles restaurants close in the early evening) Food court, shops, Bally fitness center within building Improvement Opportunities ... Internet service had problems in the room (wired connection did not work and wireless very slow ... staff were not very helpful in resolving the issue) ... and the $12.95 charge per day for a ranked hotel seems high and not necessary (should be free) Internet kiosk was always crowded ... small for the size of the hotel ... and inconvenient for guest staying in a high rise hotel Television remote did not operate very well, movies were expensive ($12.95), and the selection of TV channels seemed limited Location of hotel good for daytime walking ... but evenings are better spent indoors Hotel value good if you get special or reduced rate ... not so, if you pay full published rate

Reviews.Title: “Excellent option for concert goers !!”
Reviews.Author: Live-only-once
Reviews.Content: I was surprised to read some of the negative reviews for this hotel so I thought I would give my input. We've stayed at this particular hotel several times for the purpose of going to concerts at either the Nokia or Staples Center. The last time was in mid December of last year. We have always booked a weekend rates of $99 to $129/night, occasionally offered through SPG, specials, and such. The Hotel is modern and newly renovated. The Staff are nice and helpful enough. The rooms are large, comfortable, with beautiful views on the higher floors. The restaurant and Bar are nice and reasonably priced for a Hotel and the area. You can use the gym ( I think it's Bally's?) in the mall attached to the Hotel free of charge. Macy's was god sent when I realized I had left my sweater at home, there are food places, book store, luggage store, soothie and latte, etc... in the Mall. It's a very short walk to LA live and it is at the end of the Financial District. The parking rates are LOW compared to the $35-$40 dollars charged by other NICE Hotel in downtown. The lack of stars are due to the size and amenities not the quality of the HOTEL. The LA live Hotels cost $300+ /nt. So for the price this is a great hotel that I would stay in again for Concerts. I do tend to localize the Hotel to my needs though so for Hollywood, Universal Studios, Beverley Hills, etc...I would stay close to the areas I need to be in or visiting.

Reviews.Title: “Superb service and accomodations.”
Reviews.Author: GHOSTRIDERSanDiegoCa
Reviews.Content: I had the pleasure of staying at the Downtown L.A. Sheraton on April 17th. I received outstanding service at the front desk from associates Maricor and Miss K. Guest services were excellent. Try some throw rugs in the bathroom. The tile floor is cold. :-)

Reviews.Title: “Well located, not too expensive”
Reviews.Author: InesJF
Reviews.Content: Downtown LA isn't a great location, but the hotel is very close to the subway and 2 OK shopping centres. We spent the day on tours, in Hollywood or at the Universal Studios and at the end of the day, we could grab a bite to eat near the hotel and not pay a small fortune. The service at reception and the concierge was great and the room (we were on honeymoon and were offered a free upgrade) was enormous and extremely comfortable. Very good quality/price ratio.

Reviews.Title: “Stay here only if you have business downtown”
Reviews.Author: Humphryg
Reviews.Content: The rooms were fine and it did remind me a little of Comfort Inn, the price was a little high, the parking was expensive and difficult to get in and out (yes, the ticket did not work for us either at first). We had breakfast at the hotel - wow was it pricey! The most annoying part about our stay at the Sheraton was the incorrect information I received at checkin. I was told the price of the parking. When it came time to checkout and pay for that priviledge the next morning, turns out the the price was much higher then I was told. Worse, the 2 people behind the reception desk were very vocal and rude when I mentioned that the person checking me in quoted a different price. Don't think I will stay there again. I know there are places in LA that treat their customers with respect. This was not one of them. By the way, downtown LA is not a good place to hang out at night. Most of the shops are sealed shut and various interesting characters are walking around.

Reviews.Title: “More amenities at a Comfort Inn”
Reviews.Author: snojones509
Reviews.Content: Maybe I expected too much from a Sheraton room at $200. Scratch the veneer and you can see how old (not in a good way) this hotel really is. The lobby looks great, but head upstairs and you can see the carpet fading....in room decor is fine, bed pretty decent. But there are no in-room safes, so your passport, laptop, Rx's, not secure when you're away. Plastic water cups and paper coffee cups - so low end, so not green, so 'old roadside motel'. Bathroom toiletries also very low end. No in room bar/fridge. No ipod hookup. Elderly yellowed telephone. Bathroom had no heat lamp or fan. Tub old, almost slipped in the shower. So while the decor itself was updated, the amenities were low end and not current. Oh you can hear the guy next door's entire phone conversation. Staff was nice. Room service breakfast was good. But really I have gotten a bigger bang for my buck at a decent motel chain.

Reviews.Title: “Good, but I expect more”
Reviews.Author: carcalumo
Reviews.Content: Being a Sheraton I expect much more. Maybe little details, but finally affect your stay. Problems with the parking ticket, with the check out, waiting a lot for guest service desk, a poor internet signal, are situations that can be improved. Location is fine, close to supermarkets, restaurants and the Convention Center. The room was fine, but nothing extraordinary, considering the price.

Reviews.Title: “After a 5-day stay, I don't get all the negative reviews.”
Reviews.Author: Claybow
Reviews.Content: With trepidation I booked my stay in Los Angeles for the LA Art Show. The reviews are all over the map from horrible to excellent. From my first step inside the door until I left five days later, I had a wonderful experience. The desk clerk was very friendly and got me a fabulous corner room on the 20th floor. It says that the 20 and 21 floors are reserved for SPG members, but I have no way of knowing if this is true or not. My room (2001) was fantastic. Double beds with full-length windows on two sides. The view was nothing special, except when the sun rose over the mountains to the east. My only regret was that the room didn't have a mini-fridge. The other thing that amazed me was how quiet room was. The ice machine and stairwell was between this room and the next, so there was a buffer. I seldom heard or saw anyone. The desk was easy to use with several outlets. I worked several mornings in the room and was very comfortable. While I slept just fine every night, due to the cooler weather and all the windows, I couldn't get the room as warm as I would have liked. I would have been comfortable to stay at the Sheraton for a month. It's within walking distance of several great great restaurants, the Convention Center, and the Disney Concert Hall. While the restaurant at the hotel is pricey, the Macy Plaza is attached and I had several smoothies from Bally's and Robeks during the week to supplement my diet. I'd definitely stay here again, as long as I can get this kind of room!

Reviews.Title: “Nice Hotel... but nothing happening around here in the evening...”
Reviews.Author: NewDiverDown
Reviews.Content: Stayed here with my father and two brothers. We came down to see the Dodgers and this seemed to be close to Dodger Stadium. Nice Hotel, attached to a Mall that I never went to. Parking can be pricey, but there are some cheaper options nearby to keep those costs in check. As it says, this hotel is located in downtown Los Angeles. I assumed there would be a million things to do around here... After the Dodger game on a Tuesday night my brother and I went for a walk to find a place to get a beer or something. It was like a ghost town. I am sure there was a lot of cool stuff going on somewhere in L.A. but it certainly wasn't anywhere near this Hotel! That said, the hotel was clean, the staff was great, and I have nothing negative to say about this place.

Reviews.Title: “Quality hotel and convenient to Staples Center”
Reviews.Author: natjaye
Reviews.Content: Top of the line for the Sheraton brand. Business atmosphere, but rooms are spacious and upgraded. Not much in the way of views, but it's LA, so not a priority. The best part is the location with 10 min to Staples Center and LA Live dining area, it's ideal. Easy and hassle-free stay. Expect to pay $32 for valet parking overnight.

Reviews.Title: “Good luck”
Reviews.Author: dragonflynda
Reviews.Content: The rooms are not sound proof, you can hear everything in the next room, the hall, the stairs from the room. I picked this hotel because it had a restaurant that stayed open to 11 pm. As a woman alone, I am not going out on the streets of Los Angeles to find food. I got to the hotel with a fantasy about a good night's sleep and a good meal. I found out when I checked in that all of their restaurants would be closed tonight because of New Years Eve and I would have to get food from the bar. Nix that idea and I checked, all the "tables" were filled with people drinking. There's still room service albeit expensive. I got up to my floor and there was all kinds of noise and racket going on and two girls scantily dressed with angel wings on, with a guy. They left a broken beer bottle and trash on the floor. This is in one of the expensive downtown hotels -- but it is New Year's Eve and a Blue Moon to boot. Got in my room, opposite hallway from them and looked for room service menu. I called room service and was told it would be an hour and that I should go to the bar. No thanks on both counts. I thought I saw a sandwich shop on the first floor and went back, no it served pastries. The elevators were full trying to go back up. Called room service and yes I do want that order. I hear a lot of noise in the hotel and out on the streets so my fantasy of a good night's sleep is probably shattered. A lot of the people are here for the Rose Bowl from what I have overheard and the rest are partiers. So, this is Los Angeles on one of the busiest nights of the year. You can hear everything going on in the next room, the hall, the stairs in your room. I picked this hotel because they were supposed to have a restaurant that stayed open until 11:00. As a woman, I am not going out on the streets to find food at night in Los Angeles. I can only hope they have breakfast in the morning.

Reviews.Title: “Enjoyed our stay”
Reviews.Author: ritzgirl34
Reviews.Content: First off, I am not a big city girl, so I'm not sure if the parking situation was normal or not, but for me it was very confusing. We finally got the car parked ($28 a day, btw) and had to walk through an underground mall, I guess you could call it. It was weird hauling our luggage past Macys, Carls Jr, and Bally Total Fitness. I don't know how much valet parking was, but I am 99% sure I would use it if we stay here again. Upon check in we were asked if we are light sleepers. We are not, so we were offered a room upgrade to a 15th floor junior suite and warned ahead of time that it is next to the elevator shaft. The girl at the front desk was super friendly and even gave us suggestions on cool night spots and some good places to eat. We did hear the elevator, but it was just a "woosh" noise that was easily ignored. Thought it was weird that the heater had temp controls in the living and bedroom areas, but the on/off switch was only in the living area. We could only use the tv remote in the bedroom (they had a notice posted that they are having issues with the two tvs/remotes interferring with each other - they are working on fixing it), but that wasn't really a problem for us as we only watched tv before bed anyways. I wish the livingroom had a coffee table - the room felt like it was missing something. Overall cleanliess was fine. The ceilings could use a repainting, but the furniture and decor was up to date. Shower took FOREVER (at least 15 mins) to warm up, but once it did, it was fine. The lobby had 4 computers with internet and printers available for guest use. Guests are also allowed access to Ballys by showing their room key.

Reviews.Title: “Funky, and not in a good way”
Reviews.Author: Aredubyou
Reviews.Content: I stayed here for 3 nights on business. I got a great rate through AAA (about $100/night with prepayment) which is why I chose this spot. Pluses: The location is great, and the common areas are very nice. The room and bathroom were good sized (I was given a room with 2 double beds). I ordered breakfast from room service and it came promptly and was generous - but expensive. Minuses: The rooms look like they haven't been updated since the 70s. I had to have Engineering work on the ventilation system because a constant whooshing sound kept me awake. They improved it, but couldn't make the sound go away. I was offered another room, but the noise was comparable so I stayed put. There's only one phone in the room and it's across the room from the desk -- so I had to take my computer to bed when I had phone meetings. No speakerphone. Very expensive Internet ($12.95/day) and they charged me twice in the same day because the access runs from 3 pm to 3 pm, so I paid at 8 am and again at 5 pm. Parking is $30/day, which is standard for downtown.

Reviews.Title: “Never again”
Reviews.Author: trvlin4wrk
Reviews.Content: I travel frequently for work and I would consider myself rather low maintenance but WOW, this is the worst hotel experience I have ever encountered! So to start I checked in and the lady at the front desk was rude then I checked into my room and was thinking ok nothing impressive and everything is outdated. On the plus side they have a nice TV but to bad the controller doesn't work. I turned the AC on and I heard a lot of noise but didn't feel any cold air. Figure oh well good thing its not summer, but better get to bed. Call down to the front desk to get a wake up call and let the phone ring over 40 times with no answer so I call the main reservation line from my cell phone and ask them to connect me. They point out they are not part of the hotel and can't connect me, I ask to speak to the manager and he tries calling the front desk and no answer for him, he says "hum this isn't any good but I'm sorry I can't get in touch with them either." After that he says enjoy your stay and good night, no solution! Next day my internet doesn't work after I paid $25 so I call and yay someone answers but their answer is the internet only goes until 3pm the next day. I explain that I purchased the internet at midnight and it is now 6am so the 3pm deadline has not been hit yet and she keeps explaining that it won't work since its after 3pm. I ask to speak to her manager and he points out that the wireless internet is slow b/c it is from another company and not through the hotel but I can pay again and plug into the internet. Ok so I just hang up in shock at how this hotel is run and go grab dinner. I call the front desk just to confirm the check out time since they do not provide anything in the hotel to discuss amenities or hours or anything and I wait 37 minutes when they finally answer! So basically I am saying I would stay anywhere but here in the future. I actually usually stay at the biltmore but thought it would be nice to try something different and hopefully newer but I will never stay at THIS Sheraton again, the motel 6 has better service (maybe not as clean of rooms) but just as outdated. Good luck with your stay!

Reviews.Title: “Good service, and reduced corporate 'feel' at this remodeled hotel”
Reviews.Author: jayjay2000
Reviews.Content: Following TripAdvisor reviews, I went for this hotel - and was not disappointed. Bedrooms are good size and in great condition. Lobby areas are quiet, yet stylish. Welcoming bar with good food (not cheap though). Best of all, front desk service was impeccable - I did not feel that I was 'another suit in another corporate hotel'. Would gladly stay next time in LA - colleagues who stayed in similar LA hotels reported generally bad experiences, especially in regards to age of bedrooms

Reviews.Title: “Nicer than I thought for an older hotel”
Reviews.Author: TravelGirl03Omaha_NE
Reviews.Content: Nicely remodeled - nice rooms for an older hotel. I think we were on the 17th floor. Very, very quiet. A word of advise, don't eat at the "fake" italian restaurant (when they serve butter not olive oil, its most definitely fake!) in the hotel for dinner. Go somewhere else. Service took forever, getting the bill took forever, etc. We wondered what was going on as it took an inordinate amount of time. There's a rite aid across the street which is convenient. However I think we nearly escaped being mugged by someone begging for mooney outside and it was just around 7 PM on a Sunday. There's an IHOP nearby - breakfast is actually better there and much more resonable. I work for a nonprofit and I'm not going to turn in a $25 breakfast when I can get the same thing down the corner for $7. The negatives were the service. Service in teh restaurant was horrible. The hotel booked super shuttle for us and required a $2/per person deposit. We paid that and then the super shuttle driver said we didn't (although our receipt said we did.) We refused to pay it and told the driver we'd walk over and get the police at the airport to settle it and then he said he'd eat the deposit. Super shuttle then said I couldn't pay them on my corporate card, although the hotel staff said I would be able to. Not a big deal, but miscommunication and annyoing.

Reviews.Title: “Best of Downtown LA”
Reviews.Author: theryguy23
Reviews.Content: I was very impressed by our Stay at the Sheraton Downtown. When Air Canada screwed up our flights, I phone the Sheraton and they cancelled our first night's reservation even though technically they did not have to. When our hot water was not working, they gave us buffet breakfast. - free. They gave us a cot for our room -free. They upgraded us to one of the best rooms in the hotel - free. They went out of their way to give us a great stay. Clean rooms, friendly staff, great location - close to conference center, great conference rate. I only wish they had had a swimming pool too. No big deal. I will be here again.

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel with expensiv parking”
Reviews.Author: sajopik
Reviews.Content: We stayed there for couple of days in remodeled rooms. Room was clean and nice. We had nothing to complain about the service or hotel itself. They always had fresh fruit in the gym and orange water in the reception.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful facility but poor service and incompetent staff”
Reviews.Author: DakotaBlues
Reviews.Content: This may be a good business hotel monday-Friday but on the Saturday we stayed it was a joke. At 2pm we called room service to order off the room service menu but were told room service didn't start until 5. We said, okay, we'll come down to the bar ourselves, but they said the bar was closed. We hung up and then called back, asking where in the hotel can we get a snack or a cocktail? The front desk said, and "guest services" confirmed that there was nowhere in the entire 20+ story hotel where a guest could eat or drink. They transferred me to the Bell Desk thinking maybe one of those guys would know of a bar within walking distance! This is a hotel in the heart of downtown LA's business district! The bellman suggested a couple of bars but we're not bar people. We were just hungry and thirsty. Five minutes later he called me back, shock in his voice. He had discovered the hotel bar was open! (Didn't the people at the front desk or guest services realize this?) I went down to get food. The bartender told me that the bar was the only place to eat that evening, that the restaurant was closed. This contradicted his coworker at the front desk, who had assured us on check-in a few hours earlier that we could eat any time that evening at the restaurant!!! Next morning, room service was so amazingly incompetent just in the process of taking our order that I said, never mind. Instead I went to make coffee with our in-room coffee maker and the coffee insert was 3x bigger than the receptical in the pot - they supplied the wrong size of coffee packet for the maker! My husband and I just started laughing. The whole thing was so stupid it was amazing. We'll never stay there again. For $180 a night it sure was a bad choice of hotel.

Reviews.Title: “They take care of their SPG Customers! ~ A+”
Reviews.Author: Soccer_Dad_and_Son
Reviews.Content: This hotel definately goes above and beyond for it's SPG members! Thank you to the front desk staff who included breakfast buffett coupons and an upgrade due to my SPG status. It is nice to know that I am a valued customer and that my business was appreciated. This seemed to be one of the better managed Sheraton's I have been to (a brand that has recently seen new life in my experience). I like where this brand is headed and hope that more Sheratons will follow this model set forth. I don't know if this hotel is a franchise or corporate owned, but the level of brand consistency and overall experience was incredible. Great Job Sheraton LA!!!

Reviews.Title: “Great rate, great location, all the amenities!”
Reviews.Author: California Sun
Reviews.Content: $99 on priceline was the bid I made and got. I didn't think for a minute for $99 I would get a hotel like this downtown. What a nice surprise when I got there. It is well situated in downtown just 3 miles from USC where I had to go. Pulled up and received valet parking right then and there (which all over CA can cost you anywhere from $15-30 dollars a night) but I was tired it was late and I thought what the heck. The hotel is beautiful, fully equiped with bar, restaurant (a little pricey) a cute boutique (that had very reasonable cute jewerly) amoung other shops that I didn't stop at. Staff was very friendly, my room was modern, clean, nice bed (WHEW!!!!! what a nice surprise) You never know about hotels, expecially when it comes to CA, they are all well traveled with millions of people in and out of them for either work or play. You can get a dump paying a high price and then you can get a pleasant surprise like the Sheraton Downtown for a hundred bucks. Oh, and when I had my car pulled up the next moring I thought oh boy here comes the charge for the valet parking, ANOTHER NICE SURPRISE!!!!!!!!!! NO FEE!!!!! It is $30 if you just want to use the garage for parking and you are not a hotel guest but, a hotel guest is FREE! You NEVER get this CA. I will always go back to the SHERATON!

Reviews.Title: “Very average downtown LA hotel.”
Reviews.Author: ElenaAP
Reviews.Content: This hotel was, in my opinion, very average. Room service arrived cold (though the staff was very friendly). The hotel’s restaurants kept odd hours, so we would have to step out for lunch (it simply wasn’t served). There was an odd “Being John Malkovich” type small cutout door in the bathroom … not exactly sure what it was for?? The hotel layout is a bit annoying: you have to go up a level to catch the elevators, but you can take the elevators down to the ground level (not having the ability to do both is annoying – if security is an issue, perhaps other measures should be taken as well). Cabs were abundant, and I believe there was mass transit nearby. I was in town for a convention at the LACC, which was within walking distance (so the Staples Center is just as close). There are plenty of decent bars and restaurants in the area, so you won’t feel like you’re missing out at the hotel. Regarding the view … it’s downtown, so there isn’t one. All in all, just an average hotel - nothing spectacular

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel!”
Reviews.Author: CIVOG
Reviews.Content: I stayed here just for one night after a trip of 20 hours! It was a very nice and quiet room, with the heavenly (Sheraton) king bed, right what we needed after that trip! On next day we went to LA Downtown, during the morning ,which is not very interesting: I just liked to see the Walt Disney Concert Hall and Stapples Center with the Nokia Plaza in front of it. The Cathedral was a disapointment (it is not that I was expecting an old cathedral, as the US obvisously don't have them, but in NY you can find a nice and modern Cathedral...). We had lunch at the bar (as the restaurants in the mall next to the hotel seemed to be quite empty and not very inviting!) and the sandwiches with fries were delicious! The service at the bar was very good as well. All the staff was very friendly and helpful!

Reviews.Title: “Don't Stay here as a tourist, yes it is a clean hotel but the worst location for tourists!”
Reviews.Author: england12320
Reviews.Content: We liked the hotel, staff were friendly, rooms were ok and had free internet access but it is literally the worst location for tourists. It is in the business district which is actually pretty rough, lots of tramps about and weird people, which makes you feel very uncomfortable especially when visiting somewhere for the first time. Yes some may argue the tramps are harmless, but as a tourist it is not what you want to see. Subway aswell was an uncomfortable experience, lots of weird people there too! Felt hollywood was the same! If you must go to visit the main attractions, I would stay in West Hollywood/Beverly Hills. Alot closer to what you want to see and thus you don't need to take public transport. If you have already booked the Sheraton, then hire a car.I am only 21 so it was expensive, but obviously for people over 25, its ok. If i was to go anywhere in LA, i would probs choose Santa Monica or go to Orange County, heard these are the best places to see!Would not recommend this hotel on the basis of its location otherwise it is clean and comfortable.

Reviews.Title: “Average Weekend Hotel”
Reviews.Author: PiratesSayARRR
Reviews.Content: This is definitely a business hotel. The valet parking is reached by navigating a maze in an underground parking structure. Dropping off the car the valet attendant asked me for my room number. I informed him I have not even checked in as of yet. He then asked me for my last name...when I began spelling it he handed the paper and pen to me to ask me to write it down. I figured because it could not speak english...but he wasn't mean about it and did so in a shy manner. Checked in at the Platinum and Gold members check-in. It was speedy and efficient I was surprised they did not place me on one of the preferred floors. Room number 1201. Corner Room with Wrap around windows, clean and pretty much a standard business hotel. I found it odd that the lobby opened to a mall and actually when we arrived back to the hotel Saturday night we actually walked through the mall around midnight. It was creepy and had a touch of "dawn of the dead" feeling to it. Ordered room service the next morning and it was good...really good in fact. It was probably the most impressive part of our short stay. Really hearty portions and tasted just awesome. My fiance's pancakes were really fluffy and my omelet was very good and filling.

Reviews.Title: “i expected much more”
Reviews.Author: elys79
Reviews.Content: In my country when you say Sheraton, you mean on 5 star hotels and luxury only. In Los Angeles Downtown I found only average rooms, service and hotel look. It's somekind dirty, location is not perfect as you don't have anything to do in downtown except business...Next time I will choose beach hotel or something like that...

Reviews.Title: “Good downtown location, great business hotel”
Reviews.Author: jeepdon
Reviews.Content: Rooms are roomy, comfortable, and clean. The free use of the neigboring Bally's Total Fitness makes it the best hotel gym ever - free workout towels from the front desk. Restaurants are friendly with good (not great) food and quick service. The attached shopping mall provides diversions and sundries, as well as access to a Macy's for anything you've forgotten to pack. 20-minute walk to LA Live, Staples Center, and the Convention Center, as well as numerous brand-name restaurants (Roy's, Ciudad, etc) make this a central location. Rooms are quiet, clean, and well-appointed. Apart from the typically overpriced high-speed, there's little more you can ask for from a business hotel. Parking is the usual downtown-expensive, even self-park; note that if you valet upon arrival you will be billed daily even if you switch to self-park. A call to the front desk immediately resolved the error.

Reviews.Title: “Average hotel but outdated”
Reviews.Author: enilk3
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for two nights while in LA for business. Likes: Convenient downtown location. As a Starwood Preferred Guest member I got a voucher for a free buffet breakfast which was really good. Dislikes: Valet parking was expensive. It is attached to a mall and the decor seemed outdated. It was the first hotel room I've had in the past couple of years that didn't have a flat screen TV or other modern amenities. Would probably try somewhere else next time I'm in LA.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location and Service”
Reviews.Author: olytrvlr
Reviews.Content: Great hotel if you want to stay downtown. If you go to the bar in the hotel ask them to make you the "blueberry mojito martini" - FABULOUS! Room was good, service was great. It was nice to have the mall attached to the hotel. Had a massage at the Salon located in the mall, Anis is excellent. My friend had a great facial too. The salon doesn't look to great, but the service was beyond my expectations. Try Wokcano around the corner for dinner - very good sushi!

Reviews.Title: “OK Hotel, Good room price, but that's all.”
Reviews.Author: dnwrkn
Reviews.Content: Selected hotel based on price and location, close to visit our son at USC. Have also stayed at nearby Marriott as Downtown area is a quick drive past the Staples Center on Figueroa St to get to the USC campus. Pre-paid $95 per night for three night stay. The hotel doesn't feel new. It's attached to a Macys with a few run-down looking stores and a 2nd-rate food court that I wouldn't want to eat in. Yes, it has a couple of well-known chain stores like Victoria's Secret, but it just feels like a mall from 25 years ago--all brick facade and boring. Liked: As others have noted, average looking hotel rooms, but comfortable beds, big desk, extra chair. Polite, efficient front desk. Quick housekeeping response when we requested extra towels--arrived within minutes. Very good wireless in room and as AT&T customers it was free instead of $12.95 per day. Lobby is small but it had very nice free internet station with 4 Dell XPS One systems set up for surfing, printing boarding passes, etc. Also had several stations where users could plug in their own systems to work. I thought this was a very nice thing to offer and better than the typical hotel business office. Disliked: Ridiculous price of $28 per night for valet, especially since after your initial check-in you have to drive the car down a ramp and through a gate, to bring the car to the valet station in the basement of the garage. I mean what am I paying for if I can't have curbside or front door service every time? Stayed in room 800. LOUD street noise for the 8th floor. No hot water in bathroom. Sometimes we had to let the water run about 10 minutes before it would warm up--no exaggeration! Another weird thing--There was HVAC ductwork over the bed with two giant air filters directly overhead as an intake for the HVAC duct system. You know the type of dust filter you have to change on your furnace every couple of months? Imagine having two huge ones directly over your pillow at night. I'm not a germaphobe, but it's gross.
