Why weren't these intakes on the wall or at least not directly over the bed? I'm still asking myself why I didn't request another room? We didn't eat in the hotel, but the Pannini Cafe at 9th st was very good for breakfast and lunch. Maria's Downtown Italian restaurant (615 S Flower) was enjoyable for dinner. Used the Bally's gym which is across the hall in the attached mall and is free for hotel guests. That's a nice amenity except for the fact that like the mall, this gym had a very run-down feeling to it. While my wife worked out on an eliptical trainer, I tried 4 machines before I could find one that worked right. Another 6 cardio machines had Out of Order signs. After some cardio work, went to the free weight area, which had a very good assortment of equipment. Unfortunately again, in various degrees of disrepair. So great to have a major gym versus the usual one little room most hotels have, but such a poor quality gym--I would never buy a membership if I lived here! Overall--I expect more from a major chain like Sheraton. I felt like it met my immediate need for a place to stay based on location and a very good internet price, but I wouldn't consider this a destination hotel and probably wouldn't stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Hot and Cold, Cold and Hot”
Reviews.Author: Retailwonderer
Reviews.Content: Many things were okay, but I can't give this hotel a good rating due to the temperature variations in my room. (I have a travel alarm with a built-in thermometer, so this was not a subjective impression, or caused by hormone fluctuations!) There is a little slider on the wall for Warm-------Cool. During my 4 day stay, I could find no pattern to the settings; I think there is one setting for the entire hotel and you just get what you get. Thinking perhaps I could turn the system off and use a fan, I asked for one, but was told they were all in use by other guests. (That should have triggered me to start looking for another hotel the second day.) On the last night, I was excited to find cool air blowing out of the vent at bed time, so I left the slider all the way on the Cool side. It was 68F when I went to bed (yes, I like to sleep cold) but I woke up sweating at 3am to find the temperature at 75F. At 7am, it was 72F. I never touched the slider. The windows don't open, although it was noisy enough with them closed. Because of this random temperature issue, I will not stay here again. Good location and I liked being attached to the mall. Lots of shops and fast food places. Several restaurants within a block. Self parking is expensive ($26/day) and complicated with many levels. Valet is only $2 more but it can take longer to get your car when they're busy. Room service was prompt and good, but expensive. Internet was very good, but $13/day. Hotel staff was average. I wish there were better hotel options in the area.

Reviews.Title: “Not all Sheraton Hotels are created equal.”
Reviews.Author: WendySantaCruz
Reviews.Content: Having been a long time Starwood Rewards member we have stayed at many fine Sheraton, Westin, and W Hotels . The Sheraton Los Angeles Downtown did not come close to meeting our expectations. We expect a Sheraton Hotel to have a very helpful and cooperative staff, a very comfortable bed, updated furnishings, soft and fluffy towels, bath robes, and a TV that works. The Sheraton Los Angeles Downtown provided none of that. The front counter staff was rude and uncooperative, the bed was not very comfortable, and the towels were thin and rough as sand paper. The TV was ancient and the remote did not work. Overall this was a very bad experience. We will not be staying here again.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location & Excellent Staff”
Reviews.Author: Graygab1
Reviews.Content: This was the second time my friends and I stayed at this Sheraton hotel located right in the heart of downtown L.A. We chose to come back to this hotel because of the cleanliness, location, and the friendliness of the staff. The hotel is easy to get to from LAX airport via the train station. The total cost to ride the train from the airport is about $3.00 and takes roughly 40 minutes. The station is located conveniently across the street from the hotel. Some of the hotel staff have worked at this hotel for more than 20 years and are very eager to assist you with your needs. The rooms are very clean and the beds are quite comfy; also the bathrooms have plenty of hot water! We did not eat at the hotel restaurant because it is quite pricey, however we did hear that the food is good. There is a bar in the hotel lobby that has a pretty good happy hour with decent appetizers to boot! If you're hungry there are some good places to eat around the downtown area and near the Staples Center. You can easily walk there in about 5-10 minutes (even at night). This hotel is connected to a pretty decent shopping center and food court. Also, if you want to workout, all you have to do is show your room key at the Bally's that's located in the shopping center. The only unfortunate thing about our stay is that the business center was down, so we had no internet access other than our cell phones. Although we had a laptop, the pricing for wireless connections in our hotel room just wasn't reasonable in our opinion. However, the staff will print out your boarding pass for you without hesitation.

Reviews.Title: “Great Downtown Hotel”
Reviews.Author: ebwhyte
Reviews.Content: I must admit that I'm somewhat over-zealous when it comes to planning a trip. I visit multiple sites; multiple times to read user reviews as well as professional reviews before booking. I really try to get a good feel about what the type of clientele a hotel or resort caters to as well as the level of service a particular place offers. Well, my family traveled to Los Angeles for my aunt's 100th birthday celebration. We frequently travel to the LA area and normally stay at the Sheraton Universal for a variety of reason; mainly the close proximity to Universal Studios and CityWalk. However, for this trip I looked for a hotel that was closer to my aunt's house and the venue for her party. This led me to downtown. The Sheraton LA Downtown was absolutely perfect. The hotel lobby area was beautifully and tastefully done. All the necessary ammenities were there; gym, gift shop, restaurants, lobby bar, room service, concierge, etc. The service was excellent and up to par for what you would expect from a four-star stay. The rooms were wonderfully appointed with starbucks coffee, fantastic soap, lotion, shampoo & conditioner, etc. The prices were high in the lobby bar; however, on Friday night they had a jazz combo and 1/2 off drinks and appetizers which was a nice surprise. The Macy's Plaza mall is connected to the hotel which was a great place for low cost meals. It was a small mall but was nice to have shopping options available. Rite Aid is located across the street for snacks and those forgotten must-haves. Overall, it was a great stay.

Reviews.Title: “O.K.”
Reviews.Author: US40
Reviews.Content: Great location, convinient to many Down Town businesses. The hotel is O.K. - Nothing outstanding, the rooms are showing their age, the noise level is not too bad but not really quiet either. I would not pay top dollar for this property, but generally they offer better rates than compareable hotels. I like their lobby bar for a late night drink, the restaurant (breakfast) is nothing to brag about. I'd recommend breakfast elsewehere. A good dining option is an italian restaurant "Zucca" just a short walk around the block. Many other restaurants and the Staples Center are nearby.

Reviews.Title: “Sleek, Sexy,..your Basic Blacks for corporate stay”
Reviews.Author: GRRRLTRAVELER
Reviews.Content: The Sheraton's, like the Hyatt's, have a consistent layout and its a formula that's hard to get wrong. Sheraton sports an elegance that appeals to the corporate side of me. The rooms have a very POWER -corporate appeal and offers a sleekly and sexy luxury work-stay environment. "Light, sweet and carefree" are not the words to describe it the feeling that hits you when you enter your room...its more like "intentional and slick". The hotel obviously has the capability to function as a romantic getaway ...just with a bit of a Cassanova charm.=-) The service is what you would expect a 4-star hotel to be. Staff was friendly and helpful but it is a no-fuss environment and be prepared to open your own door. Location is the only con to this hotel but I would say that of any hotel located in downtown LA: while this Sheraton offers an underground carport parking lot with valet, driving or finding your hotel in downtown LA is not convenient unless you have a GPS.

Reviews.Title: “Would not return if it were free.”
Reviews.Author: tcmorse6570
Reviews.Content: Booked a "panoramic" corner room. We got a room on the sixth floor with a panorama of Hope St. and Good God, what was I thinking. Truck noise never stopped, even at 3 AM. They need much better sound proofing. The room service menu said 24/7, but when I called for a club sandwich at 4 PM, I was told room service did not start until 5. Parking is a nightmare. Basically, you park in the shopping mall and work your way to the lobby below street level. Check-in was pleasant and the person was very polite. She gave us a card to use that supposedly gave us in and out priviliges for two days parking and was charged $26 on my bill. (We only stayed one night). We checked in at 1 PM and left at 7 AM the next morning. The parking card did not work when we left and I ended up paying another $28 to get out of the place. Walking back to the lobby was not an option at that point, because of the distance. Plus, cars were behind us and the machine kept saying "give me money now". Beds were comfortable, but the air seemed moldy and combined with the noise level, we were not able to sleep even with my 29 decible noise reducing earplugs. No safe, no mini-fridge. If you do decide to stay here, be prepared for the beggars who constantly ask for money on your way to the garage. If I had to stay in downtown LA again (which I probably won't ever again), I would stay at the Omni or the Marriott. I would not recommend the Downtown Sheraton to my worst enemy. It would just be too cruel. Tom

Reviews.Title: “Good hotel but showing it's age.”
Reviews.Author: ciphertext
Reviews.Content: I was in LA for a business conference and decided to stay at the Sheraton because of its proximity to the LA Convention Center. Overall, the hotel was fine but the rooms did seem a bit old and I had a superb view of the office building across the street. However, I was checked into a large 1bdrm suite which was nice. PROS: - Large room - Clean - Efficient staff - Access to the Bally Total Fitness - Close to Rite Aid and other stores CONS: - The room furnishings are rather old - The tvs are quite old and small - You need to pay for internet and the speed is very slow at peak times (guessing that the entire hotel is sharing one connection) - Bar closes at midnight

Reviews.Title: “Won't Return”
Reviews.Author: fashionqueen
Reviews.Content: Have been staying downtown once a month for the past 15 years for business. I don't expect perfection but was very disturbed with someone trying to enter our room at 230 in the morning while we were sleeping. It woke me. Thank God we had our security latch on. regardless if it was staff which probably it was I could not go back to sleep that night since it really shook me up. Never have I experienced anything like that. The hotel needs upgrades. Very hot in the rooms. Thermastat set at certain temp.

Reviews.Title: “Expensive and very mixed (some good, some bad points)”
Reviews.Author: Unimaginitive
Reviews.Content: Nice big room, excellent chair and table for working in the room. Comfy bed. "high speed" internet access is a complete joke. They charge $13 extra for it per day and even with a wired ethernet connection, download speeds are 10-20 KB/sec. Fellow travelers in other rooms on my trip reported the same experience so it isn't just my laptop configuration. This alone really sours the place. Excellent starbucks in-room coffee. Some sort of elevator noise occasionally even though I'm across the hall and behind a big door from the service elevators. Sound proofing is not very good. I can hear regular conversations in the room next door.

Reviews.Title: “Wasnt bad”
Reviews.Author: mrpeteb
Reviews.Content: Was in town for meetings. Wasn't a bad hotel, room was clean, had good coffee in the room, front desk was quick. The lobby bar was a typical disappointment. Very limited selection, great beers on tap but no Dem. Light beers, warm bottles of beer, SLOW service unless you sat at the bar. Breakfast was ok but it was a buffet and once you ordered they forgot about you. we sat for 15+ min's before we got up to get our bill. Overall I liked the hotel, the rooms was clean and the bed slept well.

Reviews.Title: “Not really worth the price”
Reviews.Author: amg63
Reviews.Content: I can first start off by saying it is not worth the $220+ price to stay here. The one thing that REALLY bothers me is when these "high end" hotels charge for internet access. What a bunch of BS. There is a local, economy motel in my town that offers free wi-fi and only charges $30. It's even more ridiculous when almost every mid scale hotel offers free wi-fi for its guests. Another thing that really bothered me was the old, small TV. I guess I've been spoiled by Holiday Inn Express, which is starting to offer 30+inch LCD's and Hyatt Place, which has a 42 inch Plasma with almost all HD Programming. Also, do not expect a mini bar in your room. So much for being a Sheraton "high end" hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Just okay”
Reviews.Author: kmt325
Reviews.Content: $26 for parking is too much. Especially since access to the parking garage requires one to walk through the attached mall. I suggest skipping breakfast at the hotel. There are several small bakeries and juice joints within the mall, which provide cheaper and quicker breakfast options. As an alternative, I would receommend the Sheraton in Universal City, which is much nicer.

Reviews.Title: “Better Optionos in Downtown LA”
Reviews.Author: Spamstan
Reviews.Content: I just finished a 4 night stay at the Sheraton Downtown Los Angeles. I was placed in this hotel as part of a conference. I've stayed in a few hotels in downtown LA, and after staying at the Sheraton I can say that there are much better options. There's really nothing terribly wrong with the Sheraton. But there's nothing that makes it a standout either. Location to the LA Convention Center is fine - about a 15 min walk. It's easy to get on the freeway to get elsewhere. The room was at best average, if not a little worn. Colors were dark, and while I had plenty of windows and left the drapes mostly open it never felt like the room was light enough. The furniture showed wear and tear, as did the carpet. What's surprising is that they renovated the hotel a year or two ago. The lobby was fine with lots of sitting space for casual conversation. The bar was lively, in large part because of the conference in town. The restaurant served a passable breakfast. There's no fitness center, but guests get a free pass to the Bally's right across the way, which is great. No real problems or issues. But if staying downtown you can do much better.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel, Location, Transportation”
Reviews.Author: Pepper1028
Reviews.Content: I stayed at this hotel in January, but this time a one-block walk revealed new opportunities for me (and you) for convenient transportation if you don't have a car. Check-in was very smooth through the courteous registration staff, even at 11:00 am. My king-sized bed room was spacious and accommodating. If you're a Starwood member, the water in your room ($5 each bottle) is complimentary, at least at this location. If you don't want to join, a Rite Aid is just across the street with water under $1 for each giant bottle and plenty of goodies for snacking. My only problem in the room was that the heat did not work. Be sure that your night clothes are not thin, as the blanket and other linens on the bed may not be enough to warm you. The hotel is attached to a mall with Macy's, a U.S. Post Office, and other shops, including upscale and fast food eateries. As a guest, you are provided with complimentary passes to Bally's for fitness, in the mall across from the hotel. One block over, on South Flower Street, there's a Quiznos and plenty of transportation by bus and train (Metro) to travel to different parts of Los Angeles. A Subway sandwich shop and IHOP are also close. If you have a car, self parking is available at the hotel for $26. I enjoyed my stay and put this hotel on my "will visit again" list. It's a downtown location, so don't expect to see the Pacific Ocean or be surrounded by a relaxed, casual environment.

Reviews.Title: “Inconsistent”
Reviews.Author: warmweatherfan
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the Sheraton Los Angeles Downtown while attending a professional conference at the Convention Center. Over all my stay was above average, however, I felt it was inconsistent in service and amenities for a Sheraton. Check in was great and my room was spacious and comfortable. I was disappointed in the hotel information provided in the information folder. There one one sheet of paper explaining room service. That was all. Upon check out, I did not receive a bill under my door as I was expecting. When I went to the desk, it was clear that was something that should have taken place. The staff was friendly and helpful, the food at the bar and casual resturaunt was terrific and priced appropriately.

Reviews.Title: “Terrible Setup, Mediocre Hotel”
Reviews.Author: bobshady86
Reviews.Content: I stayed at this hotel from 5/25 - 5/26 for a leisure trip in Los Angeles. For people driving to the hotel, keep in mind that parking is $22 which was not mentioned anywhere when I booked the reservation. Also, actually getting to the parking structure is quite confusing and strange. You have to go into the Macy's Parking structure which is located on level 4, 5, 6. To get up there you have to go up a twirling circle that gets you very, very dizzy. After you do that you have to go down to the level floor where the entrance to the Sheraton is located. I have never experienced anything like this before. I checked in early with no problem around 12 P.M. I was given a room on the 22nd floor (given an upgrade as an elite SPG member). The room itself was very average. For the price, location, brand and reputation, I thought that the hotel could have been MUCH better. The room are a very old style of Sheratons’ while many of the other Sheratons have invested to keep up with modern trends (i.e. plasma TV’s, more vibrant colors). The room itself was very clean, good amenities and decent in size. There was nothing to brag about of the hotel. Noise level was pretty good partly because the hotel was pretty empty. I was visiting many tourist attractions so I had to keep going in and out of the parking structure which really, really annoyed me. I came back to my room around midnight and when I went to the ground floor of the mall going back to the Sheraton, I really was scared. It was like being trapped in a dark mall and night. Overall, the hotel itself is not bad, not good just average. I really don’t have anything good to say about the hotel but I hated how the hotel was set up. I will probably go somewhere else next time.

Reviews.Title: “this place is horrible”
Reviews.Author: n6877
Reviews.Content: I onlyl stayed here because it was the only place I could find with a room at the last minute when I needed one. serivice overall was below average, nothing too scary just not attentive. Rooms were below average a little on the dirty side. As a last resort it fit my need however I would never make a reservation here if I had anohter choice

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful hotel!”
Reviews.Author: happyundertow
Reviews.Content: If you want to stay downtown, this is the place. I was there on business and had to be all over the area, and the hotel was always within a few blocks so I walked everywhere. It was clean, modern and the staff are super friendly and helpful without the snobby attitude of some Hollywood hotels. I am always very picky about beds, but the Sheraton has some of the most comfortable I've ever had in a hotel. The attached mall is a little strange, but there's a good selection of fast food if you just need a quick bite. The hotel bar has decent food too. I would definitely stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Avoid the jr Suites!”
Reviews.Author: Papaleadfoot
Reviews.Content: The hotel is average but avoid the Jr Suites! A quiet sitting room adjoins the bedroom and the bedroom wraps the elevator shaft! In general he rooms are "standard" but a bit drab/dated. The dark interior lobby(s)...there are multi levels...are connected by escalators. The meeting rooms are in the sub subterranean levels which translates to no cell/internet service in the lowest level meeting room. When the escalators aren't working..oh well! The hotel located as part of the Macy's shopping center has lots of food courts and the hotel has an upscale dinner restaurant and a nice breakfast area. Bottom line is that it is an OK place to stay if downtown LA is where you want to be.

Reviews.Title: “Loved The Sheraton Downtown”
Reviews.Author: sunshinerMalta
Reviews.Content: The people working on this hotel are great. They know how to treat there customers. Really enjoyed my stay. Booked on hotwire and got a great rate. The beds are really good. For my trip I stayed in 5 diffenete hotels and the beds of this hotel are the best of them. We took breakfast there not cheap for the things they offer but again the service was top notch. The area is downtown that who is familiar with downtown knows what to expect. After 7 at night evrey were is closed. The plus is that there is the metro opposite the hotel and a rite aid. Great hotel with great staff. Good for public transport. Took the metro to go to hollywood 15 min universal 20 min. I took also the bus to santa monica from in front of the hotel took me 1hr 10 minutes to arrive to santa monica.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic Hotel Best Staff!”
Reviews.Author: jay379
Reviews.Content: Just returned from the Sheraton Downtown and had a fantastic experience! The staff were top of the line and went out of there way to make our stay very enjoyable . We needed a transfer to the airport and Liang at Guest Services arranged for a personal driver for the same price of a taxi. Front Desk staff were always very pleasant and greeted us with a smile. They really went out of there way to make recommendations on restaurants and things to do around downtown. The area does get a bit seedy at night, so I don't recommend walking around at night. My girlfriend and I went for a little walk after 7pm and a block down the road the area really gets shady. The hotel is very secure though and I never had any problems with security while there. The rooms are extremely comfortable and the beds have to be some of the best in California! Parking is kind of expensive, but that's what to expect in any downtown hotel. I normally don't stay downtown, but after my pleasant stay at this Sheraton I will always consider them for future trips to LA. The staff and the rooms are some of the best out of any hotel I have stayed in Los Angeles! I would recommend it for anyone looking to go to LA.

Reviews.Title: “My favorite hotel in California”
Reviews.Author: College_Bound_7
Reviews.Content: First off, I am a traveler. I do not "vacation" once a year at a Hilton. That said, this is one of the finest hotels I have been to. The convenience and style may not be the most leisurely, but the service is superb! I was BLOWN away at the staff. I am the CEO of a clothing company, and I was driven to ask every employee where they learned their outstanding service skills. Everyone attributed their skills to the Sheraton hotel "brand training." By service, I do not mean annoying waiters asking you questions every five minutes. We were staying downtown for a trade show at the convention center The location was very nice, and close to many restaurants. We were so impressed with the hotel's restaurant. I would compare the quality of the food to Bobby Flay's in Vegas. Please ask for Edgar at the Concierge desk and Martha at the restaurant. You will be very pleased you chose this hotel. Be prepared to pay for the bill, but it is well worth the relaxing experience in the center of LA! I will be staying here for every trip form now on.

Reviews.Title: “Awesome hotel for hotwire deal”
Reviews.Author: carey44
Reviews.Content: Checked in to the Sheraton on Dec 25th/2007 for 2 nights. Check in was quick and easy and parking was $20.00per night and is attached to mall and hotel. The room was clean and the beds are very comfortable. I was impressed with the $65.00 a night price we paid thru Hotwire. The area has a few bums but not to bad. The area was clean and very close to the Staples center. A very short walk. Mall being attached was a bonus and there are quite a few places to eat in the area.

Reviews.Title: “prostitution haven”
Reviews.Author: smokinaces9303
Reviews.Content: this place is a dump and i have low standards. you cannot escape the prostitutes and homeless after dark. panhandlers constantly @ the valet entrance, hookers there too & in the lounge, i dont mean subtle hookers never felt safe there my entire stay. the beds in the room are top notch, comparable to the westin, the only plus to this place. wasted $650 for 3 nights here, when i could have stayed at a marriott just down the road. oh well, hope this helps, buyer beware of this place, avoid at all costs.

Reviews.Title: “Fine for the price”
Reviews.Author: Mustanglovers
Reviews.Content: Stopped one night in October. After a long flight from Heathrow it was nice to crash here for the night. Got an excellent deal through Expedia a few days before for £60 which was around half normal price, and the hotel was only a short journey in the car from LAX. Parking wasn't cheap but the underground car park is safe and well lit. Reception were swift and polite and the room was the norm for Sheraton. The bathroom was looking a bit tired and the shower was pretty useless if I'm honest and refused to produce any useful pressure due to the bath/shower mechanism being worn out. Bed was comfy, though I would have probably nodded off on a bed of nails after our long, long day. Bar staff were really nice and the food we ordered was more than adequate. The coffee stand and food outlets in the mall next door were open by 6.30 am so you can breakfast before you start the day. All in all for what we paid we can't really grumble. Would we stop again...probably.

Reviews.Title: “A really nice base from which to see L.A.”
Reviews.Author: reesie1979
Reviews.Content: My husband and I began our honeymoon in Los Angeles, and chose the Sheraton Downtown hotel as a base from which to explore the city. It has a fantastic location, right near the 7th Street metro station. The hotel was large and clean, and the staff were very helpful. Our room was large and clean too, with a lovely king size bed. We had no reason to complain at all, and had a very pleasant 3 night stay.

Reviews.Title: “Very nice stay”
Reviews.Author: six2eyesblue779
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the Downtown Los Angeles Sheraton July 25-July 29. Had a very nice stay. Hotel was very clean, but somewhat dark. You can't expect too much going on downtown with it being in a business district. The hotel is connected to a mall that has a fitness club, a few food establishments, a Macy's, Express, Bath & Body Works, and a few other establishments. This came in handy when you are wanting an inexpensive dining alternative, or something just quick. There is also a Rite Aid just across the street. Very handy if you need a quick sunscreen pick-up. The room was clean, nothing exciting. The wireless internet was awful. I signed up for service one morning at 8am and I guess I didn't read the terms and conditions (I know, I know, my fault), and when we got back that evening, my internet connection was turned off. I called Wayport and they advised me that no matter what time you sign up, it will be cut off at 3pm that day. Somewhat stupid I think, but he reconnected me and gave me a coupon code for an extra day. I didn't even ask for it, so that was nice, especially since the connection was 12.95 per day. Parking is 22.00, which, I know, not a fantastic thing, but it is in a parking deck that seemed safe and the price is up to par of other downtown business district hotels in the country. I booked my room thru priceline for 70.00 a night, plus the fee and taxes. I stayed Wednesday thru Saturday. The hotel's website was quoting prices of 198.00 per night, including taxes. So not a bad deal. Overall, the staff was great, especially Melanie at check-in. Nelson, the bartender was great as well. They take care of you and are prepared to handle any issue you may have.

Reviews.Title: “Ideal Location, Nice hotel”
Reviews.Author: Phippster
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Sheraton from July 7th for 4 nights and had an excellent experience. The location is absolutely ideal with Universal Studios only 20 mins drive away and our deal on Expedia included a 2 day pass. Although not inclued in the package, we were also offered free parking, saving us $22 a day. The area itself lacks personality and although there are some good restaurants, they are hard to find. We dined at No.28 Engine Co, a great American restaurant within a block of the hotel but it took us a 20 min walk to find it originally. There is also a Bar Grill within 5 mins walk which was also a good meal. The metro is literally at the end of the road and therefore access to Hollywood easy. Overall a nice hotel, excellent location if you want to be slightly out of the madness of Hollywood but with easy access when you want it. Staff very helpful and bar staff especially polite and attentive!!

Reviews.Title: “Overall good experience”
Reviews.Author: Violeta5
Reviews.Content: We read mixed reviews on this hotel and did not know what to expect. We were going to a couple shows at The Orpheum which is why we chose to stay here. The hotel is connected to a small mall area with a Macy's, food court, salon, juice bar, Express, etc...I had actually forgotten some items, so it was convenient. There is a Rite Aid right across the street if you need anything too. The lobby area was nice and new looking-We checked in early and the lady at the front desk was extremely helpful, the room was clean, the bed was comfortable, you do have to pay for wireless, water, etc... but in general, the hotel exceeded our expectations. No swimming pool or hot tub or anything like that. The restaurant that you can get breakfast at is in a weird location in the mall, but the food was good. Did not see many transients or sketchy people, the security at the hotel was good. We never had a problem catching a cab or anything. We did walk home from the theatre a couple nights and did not encounter anything unusual or dangerous. It looked like a better option than a lot of other places that we passed in the downtown area.

Reviews.Title: “Lacking amenities, horrible service”
Reviews.Author: onlyone129
Reviews.Content: I am a Sheraton Vacation Owner, Gold status and I was very disappointed by the treatment I received at this hotel. Check-in and Check-out were extremely slow. I think it was because visitors found issues with reservations and staff were trying to fix the errors. Received room on 11th floor (not club floor as promised with Gold Membership). Room was very small and I felt trapped! Asked for another room on lower floor. Moved to 3rd floor, which only slightly bigger, but still not the club floor. The beds were hard. Definitely not the Heavenly Beds of the Westin! There was only a small tiny shower with no bathtub. Beware, there is no pool or jacuzzi at this hotel. The is a old spa, which is covered outside of the gym on the 3rd floor. But it looked as though no one had been in it for quite sometime. The rails were broken and laying next to the spa. I only stayed one night and I needed a late check out (which is has always been granted with Gold Membership. Requested the later check out and the rude staff told me they could only allow a 1pm check as they were booked 100%. I asked to speak to manager. I had received no other benefits of Gold Membership, so I thought this one request should at least be honored!! Management did grant my request. There is a mall right outside the hotel lobby which is convenient. We went on Sunday night to try and find something to eat. Most places were closed. We finally found a California Pizza Kitchen that was open until 10pm. Would definitely not stay at this hotel again!! Parking fee was $24 per night.

Reviews.Title: “Ok if you can get a good price(line)”
Reviews.Author: BayAreachick9
Reviews.Content: I booked this hotel through Priceline's "Name Your Own Price" feature, so it's not like I really chose to stay here, but the experience was decent. The pluses: convenient to the 110 and 10 freeways with easy access to Hollywood and LAX; near Original Pantry, an awesome old-fashioned breakfast place/diner; right across the street from RiteAid for your late-night toiletry needs; shares the building with a small mall (although it's mostly closed at night) with a Bally's gym; has a small fitness center with a patio for freeweights; good customer service and clean, elegant rooms. The minuses: no air conditioning in our room (it didn't bother us too much since we're from the Bay Area and never use air conditioning); limited food choices at night in the area (unless you want to spend a lot of money or eat cheap diner food at IHOP, the Pantry or Denny's); and few amenities in the room (VERY basic cable, VERY expensive movies). Definitely designed for the business traveler, and not useful for other types of folks.

Reviews.Title: “a good hotel to stay at”
Reviews.Author: big_foooot
Reviews.Content: o.k so it's not at the best location for hollywood and the beach but it's only 20 minutes away by metro which is directly outside the hotel, $3 for a day pass makes it easy on the pocket. the hotel itself is of a very good standard with the usual shop for bits and bobs but is lucky enough to be next to a mall which has a macys, bathworks, post office, carls' jr and robeks to name a few. the beds are a dream, plenty of pillows and comfortable to boot! the front desk are helpful and the concierge are good at their job, the bar is a hotel bar and the staff are not fully up to speed when it comes to service. there is a grill room which i used once and would advise against, there is a ihop and dennys round the corner that give better value. if you want peace and quiet rather than a bustling nightlife and are not bothered about jumping on the metro to get places this hotel is for you

Reviews.Title: “Good Place to Stay”
Reviews.Author: Tweetypie96
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the Sheraton April 4-6, as part of a Girls Week that originated in Vegas. We decided to take a road trip to LaLa Land and check out the sights. The hotel was very easy to find (or we just had really good Google directions). Valet was no problem, as it was included in our reservation that was found at hotels.com (we also got tickets to Universal Studios with this package). Our room was a spacious corner room found on the 24th floor. We had floor to ceiling windows on 2 walls, with a view of a bunch of buildings. Nothing spectacular, but still a nice view. There were 5 of us, so the room had 2 double beds and a rollaway bed. The rollaway had a feather bed on it, so sleeping was enjoyable for all. One downside to the room was there were not enough outlets, and the ones they had were very difficult to find. With 5 women, 5 cell phones that need charging, digital camera batteries that need charging, and general ironing, we occupied every pull we could find, and actually had to unplug some lamps in order to use the plug. The hotel amenities are few - the hotel bar is nice. We did not go to the hotel shop, and I am sure things were overpriced. There is a fitness room that we did not go to, and a business center that charges for use. One positive is that the hotel is connected to a mall, so if you wanna do some shopping, there is a Macy's (a nice one), Express, Bath and Body Works, and some other little shops. A downside to staying here was that everything shuts down at 7pm. I did not expect downtown LA to close so early, but it does. The mall closed at 7pm, Rite Aid across the street closed at 8pm, and even the IHOP on the next block shut down at 10pm. We found this out at 9:30pm and then proceed to do a mad dash sprint down the street to get there before they closed - turns out we were the last customers allowed in!!! Nothing like IHOP breakfast in the middle of the night! There were homeless people, but anyone who has ever been anywhere should not be surprised. If we go again, I would definitely stay in Hollywood or at the Beach - where there are more activities after the sun goes down!
